org.artorg.tools.phantomData.server.boot

Class StartupProgressFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.artorg.tools.phantomData.server.boot.StartupProgressFrame
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FxStartupProgressController

    public abstract class StartupProgressFrame
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract graphical startup frame with progress. Can be used for showing boot procedure.
    See Also:
    ConsoleDiverter

    • Constructor Detail

      • StartupProgressFrame

        public StartupProgressFrame()

    • Method Detail

      • setVisible

        public abstract void setVisible(boolean b)
        Parameters:
        b - Visibility. true for showing the frame graphically.

      • dispose

        public abstract void dispose()
        Destroys the frame. Not every implementation of this class needs does need this.

      • setTitle

        public abstract void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        A title that is visible in the task bar during start procedure. Depending on implementation the title will be shown on the frame but must not.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of frame.

      • setConsoleDiverter

        public void setConsoleDiverter(huma.io.ConsoleDiverter consoleDiverter)
        Parameters:
        consoleDiverter - For redirecting the console output into the startup frame for progressing during start procedure.

      • getConsoleDiverter

        public huma.io.ConsoleDiverter getConsoleDiverter()
        Returns:
        For redirecting the console output into the startup frame for progressing during start procedure.

      • getGraphic

        public abstract java.lang.Object getGraphic()
        Returns:
        Instance of the frame. E.g. Stage, Window, JFrame, ...

      • getProgress

        public double getProgress()
        Returns:
        Progress of start procedure connected by number of lines in console output.

        0.0 <= p <= 1.0

        See Also:
        getnConsoleLines()

      • setProgress

        public void setProgress(double progress)
        Parameters:
        progress - Progress of start procedure connected by number of lines in console output.

        0.0 <= p <= 1.0

        See Also:
        getnConsoleLines()

      • getnConsoleLines

        public int getnConsoleLines()
        Returns:
        Number of lines that start procedure will print in console output.

      • setnConsoleLines

        public void setnConsoleLines(int nConsoleLines)
        Parameters:
        nConsoleLines - Number of lines that start procedure will print in console output.

      • setProgressing

        public void setProgressing(boolean b)
        Parameters:
        b - Progress will start updating by console output. Can be useful to hide some of the start output and start at a specific time. Has to be set true for showing the progressing.

      • isProgressing

        public boolean isProgressing()
        Returns:
        true when progressing is started. If console output is not correctly redirected to this, true will be returned but progress will not shown correctly.
